Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: International Advisory Board, CIVIS Journal, University of Montenegro, Montenegro

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Paper presenter: ‘Obsolete, yet Obstinate and Operative?’, 18th Annual Conference of the Association for the Study of Ethnicities and Nationalism (ASEN) - Nationalism, East and West: Civic and Ethnic Conceptions of Nationhood, London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE), UK, 15-17 April 2008.

Paper presenter: ‘4th CEU Graduate Conference in Social Sciences - Global Transformations: Integration, Transition and Development’, Central European University (CEU), Budapest, Hungary, 20-22 June 2008.
Paper presenter: ‘Social, Political and Economic Change in the Western Balkans’, 3rd Regional Research Promotion Programme (RRPP) Annual Conference, Sveti Stefan, Montenegro, 25-26 May 2010.

Paper presenter: 'Transformations of Citizenship in Montenegro: A Context-Generated Evolution of Citizenship Policies', University Association for Contemporary European Studies (UACES) annual conference, Bruges, Belgium, 6-9 September 2010.

Paper presenter: ‘Citizenship Policies during the Wars of Yugoslav Disintegration: from a Wartime Strategy to a Tool of Ethnic Engineering’, 42nd Annual Convention of the Association for Slavic, East European, & Eurasian Studies (ASEES), Los Angeles, USA, 18-21 November 2010.

Paper presenter: 'The Curious Case of Montenegro's Minorities: citizenship, participation, access to cultural and socio-economic rights’, International Conference Democratization and Europeanization in the Western Balkans: Ethnic Diversity as a Factor of Democratic Consolidation, University of Vienna, Austria, 25-26 November 2010.
Panel convenor: ‘Old Game, New Players, New Rules: international dimensions of citizenship in the New Balkan States’, 8th CEEISA Convention, Kadir Has University, Istanbul

Paper presenter: ‘Per aspera ad astra: citizenship, violence and justice in the successor states of the former Yugoslavia’, 8th Central and East European International Studies Association (CEEISA) Convention, Kadir Has University, Istanbul, Turkey, 15-17 June 2011

Paper presenter: ‘Citizenship at times of conflict’, Third Global International Studies Conference (WISC) - World Crisis. Revolution or Evolution in the International Community?, University of Porto, Portugal, 17-20 August 2011.

Paper presenter: "'Cutting the Mists of the Black Mountain: the Function of Cleavages in Montenegro's Divide over Statehood and Identity', UACES 41st Annual Conference. University of Cambridge, 5-7 September 2011.

Paper presenter: ‘Money and membership: Financial conditions and impacts of citizenship’, International Migration, Integration and Social Cohesion (IMISCOE) annual conference, Warsaw, Poland, 7-9 September 2011.
Paper presenter: EUSI Tsuda International Workshop - The Eastern Enlargement of the EU and the Balkan, Tsuda College, Tokyo, Japan, 29 January 2012.

Paper presenter: ‘When two hands rock the cradle: symbolic dimensions of the divide over statehood and identity in Montenegro’, 17th Annual Association for the Study of Nationalities (ASN) Conference, Columbia University, New York, USA, 17-19 April 2012.

Paper presenter: ‘Citizenship between the ‘Image of the Nation and ‘the Image of Politics’: the Case of Montenegro’, International Migration, Integration and Social Cohesion (IMISCOE) annual conference, University of Amsterdam, The Netherlands, 28-29 August 2012.

Panel convenor: ‘Citizenship and voting in post-communist Europe: A snapshot at practices in the enlarged EU and in neighbouring countries’, International Migration, Integration and Social Cohesion (IMISCOE), University of Amsterdam, The Netherlands
Panel convenor and chair/discussant ‘Europeanisation, Minorities and Democracy promotion in South-East Europe’, UACES annual conference, University of Passau, Germany
CITSEE Conference (organised by the University of Edinburgh), 4-7 October 2012, Hotel Lafodia, Lopud, Croatia

Paper presenter: ‘Citizenship, extradition and the erosion of sovereignty in the post-Yugoslav states’, 18th Association for the Study of Nationalities (ASN) conference, Columbia University, New York, USA, 18-20 April 2013
Paper presenter: ‘The Europeanisation of Citizenship in the successor states of the former Yugoslavia - CITSEE Conference’, University of Edinburgh, UK, 6-7 June, 2013.

Paper presenter: ‘The unbearable lightness of Europeanisation: citizenship, extradition and the erosion of sovereignty in the post-Yugoslav states’, 25th Council for European Studies (CES) annual conference, University of Amsterdam, The Netherlands, 25-27 June 2013.
Paper presenter: ‘Montenegro - A Success Story in the Western Balkans?’, University Association for Contemporary European Studies (UACES) annual conference, Leeds University, UK, 1-4 September 2013.
Panel convenor: ‘Europeanisation in the Western Balkans’, panel at UACES annual conference, Leeds University, UK.
Paper presenter: ‘Montenegro's Foreign Policy’, 8th pan European European International Studies Association (EISA) Annual Conference, Warsaw, Poland, 18-21 September 2013.
Paper presenter: ‘Foreign policies of former Yugoslav States’, Exchanging Ideas on European Integration (AcadEU) Conference, University of Ljubljana, Slovenia, 23 November 2013

Paper presenter: ‘Montenegro en route to the EU’, The 28th Star. Challenges of the Croatian Accession to the EU and the European Future of Western Balkans, European University Institute, Florence, 9 December 2013.

Paper presenter: ‘The unbearable lightness of Europeanisation: extradition policies and the erosion of sovereignty in the post-Yugoslav states’, The Europeanization of the Western Balkans: State of the Art, University of Trento, Italy, 30 March 2014.

Paper presenter: ‘In the frame of party competition: citizenship and nation building in the post-Yugoslav states’, 19th Association for the Study of Nationalities (ASN) conference, Columbia University, USA, 23 – 27 April 2014.

Scientific organiser and presenter at the workshop ‘The governance and practices of citizenship in the post-Yugoslav states: the impact of Europeanisation’, Workshop at the Robert Schuman Centre for Advanced Studies, EUI, Florence

Marie Curie Fellowship, European Commission FP7-IEF grant

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Reviewer for Ethnic and Racial Studies, Journal of International Relations and Development, CEU Political Science Journal, Ethnopolitics, Journal of Southeast European and Black Sea Studies, Südosteuropa, Ethnicities, Innovation: The European Journal of Social Science Research, Journal of Common Market Studies, Europe-Asia Studies, Bertelesmann Stiftung (BTI Index)
Country expert on Montenegro, European Union Democracy Observatory, European University Institute, Florence, Italy
V-Dem expert on Montenegro, Dept. of Political Science, University of Gothenburg, Sweden
Referee and rapporteur for top 15 projects for Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (value 3 million euros), Fribourg, Switzerland
Freedom House expert for Montenegro, co-author of the report for 2013, Freedom House, Washington DC, USA
European Commission DG Justice expert on investor citizenship schemes, Brussels, Belgium

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Supervisor in Politics, School of Political and Social Science, University of Cambridge, UK • Small-group tutorials for the course ‘Politics of Security and Development’ • Small-group tutorials for the course ‘Nationalism in the Balkans’

Teaching Fellow in Comparative Politics, Department of Political Science, School of Public Policy, University College London, UK • Undergraduate course ‘Comparative Political Analysis’ with a focus on Comparative Politics of Europe • Delivery of lectures and seminars (also: e-teaching via Moodle) • Essay marking and course administration

EUI visiting lecturer, Tsuda College, Tokyo, Japan • Undergraduate course ‘The EU enlargement: dynamics, experiences, perspectives’ - full course delivery (intensive) • Essay marking and course administration
Invited speaker, University of Neuchatel, Switzerland. Lecture " Montenegrin citizenship: understanding status, rights and identity in the context of Europeanisation" (2 hours)
Guest speaker, University of East London, United Kingdom. Lecture "Policy-making in the European Union" (3 hours).
Visiting Lecturer, University of Fribourg, Switzerland • MA course ‘Transformation of Citizenship in South East Europe’ - delivery of full course (intensive) • Essay marking and course administration

Lecturer, GUSEGG Summer School (University of Graz), Seggau, July 2014 • MA/PhD level course ‘Transformations of citizenship in South-eastern Europe’ - full course delivery (intensive) • Essay marking and course administration
Invited speaker, James Madison University, Florence, Italy. Lecture "Investor citizenship" (3 hours)
Visiting Lecturer, University of Passau, Passau, Germany • (Hauptseminar) ‘Citizenship in International Relations’ - complete course delivery • Essay marking and course administration

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: International Team Leader (12 senior scholars), for the project: Confronting the Yugoslav Controversies project. Output: • Chapter ‘Montenegro’ in Confronting the Yugoslav Controversies: A Scholars’ Initiative, ed. by C. Ingrao and T. Emert (Purdue University Press, 2012)

International Team Leader, CITSEE governance cluster, University of Edinburgh, UK. Outputs: • Initial workshop during the CITSEE retreat in Lopud, September 2011 • Cluster presentations at the CITSEE symposium at the University of Edinburgh (UK), June 2013 • Workshop co-financed by CITSEE and the Robert Schuman Centre for Advanced Studies (EUI, Italy), May 2014 • Special issue of European Politics and Society, Vol. 16, Issue 3 (2015), entitled ‘The governance and practices of citizenship: the impact of Europeanisation’, J.Dzankic, S. Kacarska and N. Pantic (eds.) • Edited volume: The Europeanisation of Citizenship Governance in South-East Europe, J.Dzankic, S. Kacarska and N. Pantic (eds.) (Routledge, 2016), ISBN 78-1- 138-18506-7

Executive coordinator of EUDO Citizenship, an observatory hosted at the Robert Schuman Centre of the European University Institute in Florence. The Observatory currently covers 67 countries (analyses of citizenship and electoral laws), and the position involves the coordination of work of 147 country experts on citizenship and the franchise. Outputs (since Sept 2015): • 15 country reports on citizenship and the franchise in Europe, Asia, Americas • CITLAW and ELECLAW indicators for comparing citizenship and electoral rights worldwide • Two forum debates (‘Bloodlines and Belonging: Time to Abandon Ius Sanguinis?’ and ‘Freedom of movement under attack: Is it worth defending as the core of EU citizenship?’) • 2015 EUDO Dissemination Conference (72 participants) • 2 EUDO Citizenship Dialogues with renowned scholars

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: OSI/FCO/ Chevening Scholar, a one-year full scholarship for the pursuit of the MPhil in Contemporary European Studies at the University of Cambridge (€25,000). Programme: Contemporary European Studies

BP/ New Hall Centenary Scholar, a three-year full scholarship for the pursuit of the PhD in International Studies at the University of Cambridge (€75,000). Project title: "State and Nation in Montenegro, 1997-2007"
Marshall Memorial Fellow of the German Marshall Fund of the United States (€12,000)
University of Oslo (Norwegian Research Council project), grant for research on “Symbolic Nation-Building in Montenegro”, Norway (€5,500)

Jean Monnet Fellowship, Robert Schuman Centre for Advanced Studies, European University Institute, Florence, Italy (€48,000). Project title: "The unbearable lightness of Europeanisation : extradition policies and the erosion of sovereignty in the post-Yugoslav states"

Marie Curie Fellowship, European Commission FP7-IEF grant for a two-year research project on citizenship and party politics in the post-Yugoslav space (€179,739.60). Project title: ‘In the frame of party competition: citizenship and nation building in the post-Yugoslav states’
